image.altText: An older man lying in a hospital bed looks off to the left, resting his hand behind his head.

items.synopsis: As Russia continues its campaign in Ukraine, estimates place the number of civilian casualties in the thousands. But beyond the facts and figures are real lives changed forever by the war.

title.children: Former Soviet colonel Dmytro was out and about getting some exercise. Then he woke up in a pool of blood

image.altText: The logos of the four big banks in Australia

items.synopsis: Here's a breakdown of which major banks have responded to the RBA's June rate rise decision, and which ones we're still waiting on.

title.children: Which banks are changing their interest rates after the RBA made its 12th increase?

image.altText: a close-up of a woman's pregnant belly. she has one hand underneath her belly and one on top of it

items.synopsis: The tenants, who are of Kenyan origin, accused the husband-and-wife owners of the building of a campaign against them that included racial discrimination, surveillance, obstructing access and "humiliating and offensive" language.

title.children: 'The child once born, is not authorised': Couple wins racial discrimination case against landlord

image.altText: Brittany wears a black blazer and walks from the courthouse with David, who wears a suit. They look serious.

items.synopsis: Prime Minister Anthony Albanese insists Finance Minister Katy Gallagher did not mislead parliament and has rejected suggestions that Labor coordinated to politically benefit from former Liberal staffer Brittany Higgins's allegation as "nonsense".

title.children: Anthony Albanese rejects claims of Labor coordination over Higgins's allegation

image.altText: A close up of Donald Trump in shadow with his fist raised in the air.

items.synopsis: For the second time this year, former US president Donald Trump has been indicted on criminal charges. So, what happens now? Here's everything we know.

title.children: Trump's second indictment of the year may not be his last. This is what we know about his legal woes

image.altText: dry terrain in outback new south wales

items.synopsis: Days after the Bureau of Meteorology issued a warning that an El Niño weather event could happen, its US equivalent has raised the stakes.

title.children: US weather agency declares first El Niño in eight years is already underway

image.altText: A computer keyboard lit up in red.

items.synopsis: Russian-linked cybercriminals claim to have gone through with a threat to publish troves of sensitive data, after one of Australia’s largest law firms vowed not to bend to their ransom demands.

title.children: 'ENJOY!!': Hackers claim to go through with dark web threat after law firm refuses ransom

image.altText: Two men drink champagne while standing at an office window.

items.synopsis: Sixty-six people earned more than $14 million in the 2020-21 financial year, but new data from the Australian Taxation Office shows they paid zero income tax.

title.children: 66 people earned an average of $14.5 million in 2020-21. None of them paid a cent in tax to the ATO

image.altText: A woman with brown hair and earrings smiles at the camera.

items.synopsis: Emergency services and locals are searching for speech therapist Wendy Richardson, who is missing after a boating accident in the Torres Strait.

title.children: 'Inspirational' Cairns woman still missing in Torres Strait after boat overturns

image.altText: Rugby players wearing blue, huddle in celebration after scoring, while two opposition players in red look exhausted

items.synopsis: The Fijian side managed two wins from their inaugural season, but have muscled their way into the finals with style this year.

title.children: Proving doubters wrong all season, the Drua play their first quarterfinal against a giant they have already slayed

image.altText: Police tape lines a street where two police officers stand in the morning sun.

items.synopsis: Police have charged a Townsville woman following an alleged stabbing and two-storey balcony fall that has left a man with life-threatening injuries.

title.children: 51yo woman charged following Qld man's alleged stabbing and balcony fall

image.altText: A side view of a man wearing sunglasses and a blue suit

items.synopsis: Mark Sebo stands accused of stealing more than $1 million from the superannuation accounts of eight clients and spending it on online gambling.

title.children: Trial begins for financial adviser accused of stealing more than $1 million from clients' superannuation funds

image.altText: woman wearing a white singlet in empty room with timber pieces

items.synopsis: A North Lismore couple who have accepted a property buyback say a lack of detail on where new land will be developed is forcing their hand to leave the area.

title.children: 'Go-slow' land development squeezes flood families from Northern Rivers

image.altText: A man and a woman speaking

items.synopsis: Former detective chief inspector Pamela Young speaks for the first time after her work on the death of US mathematician Scott Johnson more than 30 years ago was examined by the NSW inquiry into LGBTIQ hate crimes.

title.children: 'Taken out of context': Detective responds to claims she was hostile towards Scott Johnson family

image.altText: A man wearing a Pink Floyd shirt.

items.synopsis: Each year, dozens of people claim to have been injured by police, but only a handful of officers end up facing court for those alleged assaults. In South Australia, police have been accused of charging their alleged victims instead, to stop their allegations being properly investigated.

title.children: Alexander forgot his concession card on a train, a mistake which ended in his arrest and hospitalisation

image.altText: An adult and baby rhinoceros at a zoo

items.synopsis: Taronga Zoo is acting to address $2.6 million in "historic underpayments" to 902 current and former casual staff at both their Sydney and Dubbo zoos.

title.children: $2.6 million owed to casual workers at two of NSW's biggest zoos

image.altText: Exterior of Cairns Courthouse building

items.synopsis: A man accused of the rape and indecent treatment of a child has been flown to Cairns by Queensland detectives to appear in court.

title.children: Sydney man extradited to Cairns to face court on child sex charges

image.altText: Calvary Hospital in Canberra

items.synopsis: The ACT Supreme Court halts Calvary Health Care's bid to stop the ACT government from taking over Calvary Public Hospital.

title.children: ACT Supreme Court dismisses Calvary Health Care's bid to stop government's hospital takeover

image.altText: Donald Trump wears a blue suit and red tie as he speaks into a microphone at a convention.

items.synopsis: Former US president Donald Trump says his lawyers have been informed that he has been indicted by the US Department of Justice for mishandling sensitive government documents.

title.children: Florida 'the centre of gravity' as US Department of Justice indicts Trump over classified documents

image.altText: a police four-wheel drive parked in the driveway of a suburban home

items.synopsis: A 16-year-old boy has been charged with attempted murder after a woman and child were allegedly stabbed at a home in the Ipswich suburb of Rosewood.

title.children: Teen charged with attempted murder over alleged Ipswich stabbing

image.altText: A wide shot of the Brisbane city hall among trees.

items.synopsis: With less than 10 months until next year's Brisbane City Council election, a new name has emerged as a potential Labor lord mayoral candidate.

title.children: Lawyer emerges as potential Brisbane mayoral candidate

image.altText: A close up shot of an Aboriginal women squinting as she lines up a shot. She has hot pink finger nails.

items.synopsis: The Tjuwanpa Women Rangers have taken up arms to protect native animals from feral predators in central Australia and have been sharpening their shooting skills.

title.children: Feral cats kill thousands of native animals each year, but this all-women ranger team is taking action

image.altText: Ukrainian emergency workers wearing radiation protection suits .

items.synopsis: One of the world's largest nuclear power plants relies on a reservoir attached to the Nova Kakhovka dam. What does that mean now the dam has been destroyed?

title.children: The Zaporizhzhia power plant used water from the destroyed Ukrainian dam. What happens now?

image.altText: a woman kneels next to a labrador dog

items.synopsis: A video of Janice Whittle and her service dog Keegan being asked to leave a Toowoomba hotel went viral this week. She says it's time everyone understood the importance of assistance dogs.

title.children: Woman with guide dog asked to leave hotel in viral video says service refusal still too common

image.altText: A medium close-up shot of ABC managing director David Anderson speaking into a microphone in a radio studio.

items.synopsis: ABC managing director David Anderson flags an acceleration of the transition to digital and away from broadcast, as he releases details of the organisation's five-year plan.

title.children: ABC radio services set to be consolidated in five-year plan, as audience moves to digital

image.altText: A man holds a fish

items.synopsis: There are fears fresh fish prices could "go through the roof" with a ban on gillnet fishing, paving the way for more imported seafood.

title.children: Fish and chip prices to rise with ban on major form of fishing, a fisheries scientist says

image.altText: Australian currency is seen next to a wages graph

items.synopsis: CBA economists slash forecasts, put odds of a recession this year at 50:50. The ASX rises. Here's how the day unfolded, with insights from our business reporters on the ABC News markets blog.

title.children: A 50 per cent chance of a recession says CBA, ASX ends higher — as it happened

image.altText: A lion cub and a black leopard cub hug each other while they sleep.

items.synopsis: The war in Ukraine has not only destroyed infrastructure and claimed human lives, but the natural environment and wildlife have been decimated and could take decades to recover when the war finally ends.

title.children: The full extent of Ukraine's environmental damage isn't known, but what has been discovered already worries experts

image.altText: Man sitting on red gopher in black seat with red kelpie sitting with paws on his lap, both looking at camera

items.synopsis: Before and after photos show the transformation of a home where two Port Lincoln siblings lived in squalor just 18 months ago. But their case worker fears more hoarders will slip through the cracks.

title.children: Look inside these reformed hoarders' home, even as a funding cut ends vital support

image.altText: A woman sits in front of a computer open to a screen showing purple and green colours

items.synopsis: Two lawyers in the United States blame artificial intelligence chatbot ChatGPT for tricking them into including fictitious legal research in a court filing.

title.children: Lawyers blame ChatGPT for tricking them into citing fake court cases

image.altText: A woman in green and a man in blue standing on a driveway, with trees in the background.

items.synopsis: It's been two years after a powerful storm brought down trees across the Dandenong Ranges, east of Melbourne, many are still struggling to repair and rebuild from that night, and not a single home has been rebuilt.

title.children: Ben thought his 'forever home' was well insured, but the cost of rebuilding is beyond his family's means

image.altText: A young girl sits in the centre of the jaws of a large shark with her sister in a wheelchair behind her

items.synopsis: The McWaters have two daughters with childhood dementia as a result of Batten Disease. They say they are luckier than some as they get to see their children grow up, but they want to see a better understanding of the disease and respite options.

title.children: Childhood dementia will cut these sisters' lives short. Their parents want better respite services — not sympathy
